page.title: 05CLAYGATE-HISTORY & PRESENT
page.content: The first written record of Claygate was just before the Battle of Hastings. t was owned by the Earl of Northumbria.The railway came in 1885 when there were 1000 people.There are now some 7000,many of whom regularly commute to London by train. With the arrival of the railway a new shopping centre has sprung up in the Parade,which offers many shops from hair-dressers and supermarkets to banks.In the Old Village,the Studio Cake Shop was the post office 120 years ago.The three pubs in Claygate are the Winning Horse,the Foley Arms and the Hare and Hounds which is the largest. The four main carparks are the Station carpark,Fine Fare supermarket, the Village Hall and by Champions(DIY suppliers).
